required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Study for the Collection Of Vocalized, Individual Digital Cough Sound Recordings to Screen for COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study for the Collection Of Vocalized, Individual Digital Cough Sound Recordings to Screen for COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: Decentralized clinical study designed to collect cough sounds and self-reported symptoms alongside a COVID-19 realtime quantitative polymerase chain reaction (rt-qPCR) test. The aim of the data collection is to develop a safe and effective cough based digital screening tool for COVID-19.

primary_outcome.measure: Collection of cough sound recordings and self-reported symptoms from a minimum of 100 COVID-19 positive participants as identified by rt-qPCR.
Development of an algorithm that uses a combination of cough sounds and self-reported symptoms that is capable of distinguishing between COVID-19 positive and COVID-19 negative participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of an algorithm that uses cough sounds that is capable of distinguishing between COVID-19 positive and COVID-19 negative participants.

other_outcome.measure: Development of an algorithm that uses a combination of cough sounds and patient-reported symptoms that is capable of predicting rt-qPCR Ct value for a participant.

intervention.intervention_name: Recordings of cough sounds from adults
intervention.description: Smartphone recordings of the cough sounds of participants who enrol in the study and obtain a COVID-19 rt-qPCR result.

study_pop.textblock:
A minimum of 100 participants who test positive for COVID-19 on rt-qPCR will be recruited. Based on average COVID-19 incidence rates in high incidence US geographies (~8-12%), this study will enrol a cohort of up to 1500 participants on a rolling basis, to allow for sufficient cough recordings from COVID-19 positive participants to be collected for analysis.
Participants will be aged 21 years and older and will not be excluded based on gender, demographic group, or geographic location within the US.
